intro: Lesquerella occidentalis var. cusickii, commonly known as the Western lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces unique seed pods that contain a valuable oil used in industrial and cosmetic applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Lesquerella occidentalis var. cusickii is an important species for both ecological and economic reasons.
